item.title: National Science Board Elects First Industry Leader in 30 Years
item.description: Dar�o Gil, Ph.D., IBM Senior Vice President and Director of Research and a member of Rensselaer’s Board of Trustees, has been elected chair of the National Science Board (NSB). While it has been more than 30 years since the NSB had a chair who was working in industry at the time of their election, two of its three previous industry leaders also had strong affiliations with RPI: Dr. Mary Good was a member of the Board of Trustees, and Dr. Roland Schmitt served as its president from 1988 to 1993.
item.author: Community

item.title: 2024 TLC Seed Project Awardees Announced
item.description: Rensselaer’s Department of Undergraduate Education and the Teaching and Learning Collaboratory (TLC) are excited to announce the winners of the 2024 seed project call! The purpose of the seed projects is to develop a project to the point that it is competitive for external funding, and the projects test new pedagogical approaches or technologies that will impact student learning. A big congratulations to this year’s winners!

item.title: Virtual Housing Fair to be Held June 5
item.description: Date: Wednesday, June 5, 2024 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM - The Off-Campus Commons is pleased to host this virtual housing fair to give students a chance to learn more about off-campus housing, meet the RPI staff who can assist, and interact with several property owners who cater to RPI students. Feel free to join the Discord Server any time during the event….
item.author: Students

item.title: Shuttle Service Available for “But to Say it Loud!” BIPOC Pride Parade
item.description: Date: Saturday, June 8, 2024 11:30 AM - 3:30 PM - The Rensselaer Union and Mueller Center will be sponsoring a shuttle bus to and from the Say it Loud! BIPOC Pride Parade, which will take place in Washington Park in downtown Albany. The bus will depart the Union Horseshoe at 11:30am and then leave Albany at 5:00pm to drop students back at the same location.

item.title: Office for Research to Hold Virtual Office Hours for Grants and Compliance
item.description: Date: Wednesday, June 5, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Individuals who have questions regarding NSF’s new SciENcv requirement, finding grant opportunities, using the new GrantForward service, and many other proposal-, grant-, and compliance-related issues are welcome to take part in these virtual office hours! The session is open to faculty, research scientists, postdocs, program managers, and business managers/administrators; one-on-one breakout sessions will also be available.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Bicentennial Commencement “Thank You” Breakfast to be Held June 12
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, June 12, 2024 8:00 AM - 9:30 AM - Thanks to the dedication of our volunteers, our Bicentennial Commencement ceremony was a success, and to celebrate and thank everyone for their hard work and dedication, a breakfast will be held in the second floor banquet room of the Russell Sage Dining Hall. If you plan to attend, please RSVP no later than Monday, June 10. We hope you will be able to join us!

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
